name: Red-necked Wallaby
description: The Red-necked Wallaby is a medium-sized marsupial with reddish fur on its neck and shoulders.
spread_note: Found in eastern Australia and Tasmania.
food_note: Grazes in open areas, often at dusk or dawn.
reproduction: Gestation about 30 days, joey stays in pouch for 9 months.
attractions: Common in zoos for their approachable nature and hopping.
projects_note: Not endangered, but habitat alteration is monitored.
breeding: Widely bred in captivity for zoos and wildlife parks.
